jSimPack

Class SimTime

  • java.lang.Object
    • jSimPack.SimTime
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<SimTime>

    public class SimTime
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<SimTime>, java.lang.Cloneable
    This class offers a units-aware represenation of simulation time. It can be used to represent a moment in time (i.e., a timestamp) or a duration. Because negative durations are valid, negative values are allowed.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • SimTime

        public SimTime(double scaledTime,
       SimTime.SimTimeUnit unit)

      • SimTime

        public SimTime(java.lang.String valueStr)
        Creates a new SimTime object based on the input string. The string should be of the form "". White space is allowed but fractional values are not. See the SimTimeUnit object for the valid unit strings.
        Parameters:
        valueStr - the string to convert

    • Method Detail

      • parseTime

        public long parseTime(java.lang.String valueStr)
        convert a string containing a number and a unit Note that the pattern used to vet the string conversion probably fails if a negative value is passed.
        Parameters:
        valueStr - The string to be converted

      • getTrunc

        public long getTrunc(SimTime.SimTimeUnit unit)
        Returns a truncated value (e.g. if native time is 2400 ns, then getTrunc(SimTimeUnit.MICROSECOND) will return 2, not 2.4.
        Parameters:
        unit - The desired unit of the return value
        Returns:
        the return value in the specified units

        public double getFracSeconds()

      • getFrac

        public double getFrac(SimTime.SimTimeUnit unit)
        Returns the floating point result, including any fractional units. For example, if native time is 2400 ns, then getFrac(SimTimeUnit.MICROSECOND) will return 2.4.
        Parameters:
        unit - The desired units
        Returns:
        the floating point result in the specified units
